value.string:
# This script is a helper to perform a global build safely.
 
 builder = context.getDeliveryBuilderValue()
 if builder is None:
 raise RuntimeError('No delivery builder available in the business path %s' % (context.getPath(),))
 
 # The key points are:
 #
 # - that making multiple deliveries when they should be merged must be avoided (safety)
 # - that waiting for unrelated active objects to be finished should be avoided (low latency)
 #
 # There are two case worth considering. One of them is where new deliveries may be created.
 # In this case, we must make sure that multiple builder processes (whether the same builder
 # or different builders) would not run against the same delivery portal type under the same
 # module, because they might need to merge deliveries. This case is a bit complicated, as
 # delivery select methods often depend on the catalog, thus it is necessary to wait for
 # the indexing of new deliveries.
 #
 # The other case is where no new deliveries may be created. This is typical when using
 # trade model lines or simplified accounting. In this case, we only need to make sure that
 # the same builder would not run in parallel, because the result is unpredictable when
 # the builder selects the same movements. Besides that, there is no risk to run the builder,
 # as the builder does no harm, even if it could not find updatable deliveries.
 if builder.getDeliveryCreatable():
 module_id = builder.getDeliveryModule()
 delivery_portal_type = builder.getDeliveryPortalType()
 serialization_tag = 'build:%s:%s' % (module_id, delivery_portal_type)
 indexing_tag = 'indexing:%s:%s' % (module_id, delivery_portal_type)
 after_tag = indexing_tag
 # XXX actually, this parameter is used even for lines and cells as well as only modifying
 # existing deliveries. So this implies that the builder may still wait unnecessarily.
 activate_kw = dict(tag=indexing_tag)
 else:
 builder_uid = builder.getUid()
 serialization_tag = 'build:%s' % (builder_uid)
 after_tag = None
 activate_kw = None
 
 builder.activate(serialization_tag=serialization_tag, after_tag=after_tag) \
 .build(activate_kw=activate_kw)
